text: George James Guida (August 29, 1924September 7, 2015) was an American sprinter who competed in the 1948 Summer Olympics running the 400 meters. He finished sixth in the final behind Arthur Wint's Olympic Record. Injured in the final, he did not run on the American 4x400 meters relay team that ultimately won the gold medal. He was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.http://grfx.cstv.com/photos/schools/nova/sports/m-track/auto_pdf/2015-16/misc_non_event/guida_obit.pdf While running for Villanova University he was the 1947 Indoor National Champion at 600 yards.http://www.legacy.usatf.org/statistics/USA- Champions/USAIndoorTF/men/500m.aspx ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1948 |Olympics |London, United Kingdom |6th |400 m |50.2 |} ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Philadelphia Category:American male sprinters Category:Olympic track and field athletes of the United States Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1948 Summer Olympics Category:Villanova Wildcats men's track and field athletes Category:Track and field athletes from Pennsylvania
title: George Guida
